messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "timotius_pamungkas"
<timotius_pamungkas@y...> wrote:
> When I call rect.setWidth(-5), it should be throw an exception, and
> it really throw an exception. The problem is, my test stop at that
> point, so rect.setWidtt(4) never executed. But all I need is it
> really throw an exception or not.

What I do is (and I think I got this from another mailing list):

public void testIAEThrown() {
MyRectangle rect = new MyRectangle();

boolean exceptionWasThrown = false;
try {
rect.setWidth(-5);
} catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
exceptionWasThrown = true;
}
assertTrue("IllegalArgumentException wasn't thrown",
exceptionWasThrown);

}

- a
